tests/FCCLattice.py

00001 #! /usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 #import BaseTest and ase
00004 from BaseTest import *
00005 
00006 #import bin scripts, and sys for argv
00007 import sys
00008 
00009 #Test specific imports
00010 import scipy as sp
00011 import pylab as py
00012 from ase.structure import bulk
00013 from scipy.optimize import fmin
00014 
00015 
00016 class FCCLattice(BaseTest):
00017     """FCCLattice test returns the optimal fcc lattice constant and energy per atom"""
00018     
00019     def __init__(self,potentialname,energy,TestDependencies=[],*args,**kwargs):
00020         """Pass the initialization arguments to the BaseTest initializer"""
00021         BaseTest.__init__(self,potentialname,energy,TestDependencies,*args,**kwargs)
00022         #self.potential = self.getASEPotentialByName(potentialname)
00023 
00024     def FCCEnergy(self,a):
00025         """This function computes the energy of the crystal formation given 
00026         a certain lattice constant
00027         
00028         It uses the ase helper function bulk to create a 1 atom periodic boundary
00029         condition crystal with a specific structure"""
00030         slab = bulk(self.element,'fcc',a=a)
00031         
00032         #set the calculator
00033         slab.set_calculator(self.potential)
00034         
00035         #calculate and return the potential energy
00036         return slab.get_potential_energy()        
00037 
00038 
00039     def TestResults(self):
00040         """FCC Lattice Test Result
00041         
00042         uses scipy fmin (a simplex method minimization tool), to find the optimal
00043         lattice constant, and corresponding energy per atom"""
00044         
00045         #choose a reasonable starting constant
00046         x0 = 3.00
00047         
00048         #minimize the energy per atom, using scipy fmin simplex minimizer.
00049         minimum, energyminimum, iterations, funcalls, warnflag = fmin(self.FCCEnergy,x0,full_output=1,disp=0)
00050         
00051         #ensure that the minimization performed as expected
00052         if not warnflag:
00053             return {'FCCLatticeConstant':minimum[0], 'FCCEnergyPerAtom':energyminimum}
00054         else:
00055             raise MinimizationError
00056 
00057 
00058     def Verify(self):
00059         """Simple verification script.  Creates a plot that shows the 
00060         crystal energy in the neighborhood of the computed minimum, along
00061         with the computed minimum, as a check """
00062         
00063         print
00064         print "Verifying minimization with plot... "
00065         minimum, energyminimum = self.TestResults()
00066         vals = minimum* sp.linspace(0.9,1.1,100)
00067         ens = map(self.FCCEnergy, vals)
00068         py.figure(1)
00069         py.clf()
00070         py.title('Energy minimization verification')
00071         py.xlabel('Lattice constant (ang)')
00072         py.ylabel('Energy (eV)')
00073         py.plot(vals,ens)
00074         py.plot(minimum,energyminimum,'r+')
00075             
00076         
00077 #Ensures the script can be called from the command line
00078 if __name__ == '__main__':
00079     test = FCCLattice(sys.argv[1],sys.argv[2],sys.argv[3:])
00080     #raises BaseTest.main
00081     print test.main()
00082
